meanings.definition: To make opaque or less transparent.
meanings.sent1: She was opaquing the window by painting it white.
meanings.sent2: The artist was opaquing the glass vase to create a unique design.
meanings.sent3: The magician opaqued the crystal ball, making it impossible to see the future.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were opaquing the sun, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The fog was opaquing the view, making it difficult to see the mountains.

meanings.definition: The act of making something opaque or less transparent.
meanings.sent1: The opaquing of the glass was done to protect the privacy of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The opaquing of the windows allowed for a cozy atmosphere inside.
meanings.sent3: The opaquing of the water in the pond made the fish look like they were swimming in milk.
meanings.sent4: The opaquing of the sky by the clouds created a gloomy mood in the park.
meanings.sent5: The opaquing of the screen made it difficult to read the text on the computer.
